chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob James Braun was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jacob James Braun is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jacob James Braun was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for Probation on 09/26/22 by 02:00 PM
- 14 days against ultimate sentence

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Sentencing Checklist. arc

ADDRESS INFO for Jacob James Braun
Current: 1615 Darlene St, Saint Paul, MN 55119 United States  (Effective: 09-23-2022)
Prior: 1294 18th St E, Hastings, MN 55033 United States
Probation review hearing on November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:44 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jacob James Braun in court.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Jacob James Braun. ADA Rockow states DE has pre-paid restitution of $197.95 in 21CM333 and moves to dismiss 21CM333 based upon the pre-payment of restitution. ADA recites resolution and DE's prior record. Court states a preliminary hearing has not been held. Atty Dolfi states DE is willing to waive prelim. ADA Rockow will file Information right now. Court will give Atty Dolfi an opportunity to speak with DE regarding waiver of prelim. Off record at 3:53 PM. Recalled at 3:55 PM. Appearances as previously stated. Court questions Defendant. Court finds DE freely and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads GUILTY to Count 1 in 22CF193. Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses Count 2 in 22CF193 and reads-in and dismisses 21CM333 in it's entirety for purposes of restitution. Sentencing arguments. Victim's rights compliance. Court questions Defendant. Defendant's sister makes statement.

Court Orders:

Count 1 in 22CF193 

W/S 3 years probation
- 300 days condition time STAYED
- Court Costs: $268      to be pd through probation
- DNA Surcharge: $250   to be pd through probation
- Restitution: $197.95 to Plant Place Garden Center   Apply money on file in 21CM333

Conditions of Probation:

- DNA Sample
- Successfully complete recommendations of Rule 25 and provide information to agent
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to possess a firearm
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
- Sign up for probation by 9/26/22 at 2 PM
- 14 days credit against ultimate sentence

Adjourned at 4:16 PM.  gll
Probation review hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 23, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

4:15 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson.  Attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court, Defendant Jacob James Braun appeared by video. Includes 21CM333 and 22CF193. Court reviews case. Court reviews bond not signed and returned. Court gives DE 1 week to get bond returned. DE states counselor mailed bond. JA to email bond to DE. DE is to sign and return bond. Atty Dolfi states there is a resolution and requests pleas. Court sets PLEAS. DE updates address. Adjourned 04:25 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Whitney H.
